intro: Artanthe decurrens, commonly known as the slender artanthe, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. Artanthe decurrens is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
